00:00:02:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:02:050000.Dialogue: Okay in Avatar when they gave sex in Pandora they hook up their ponytails, so we know their ponytails are like their junk.

00:00:11:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:11:130000.Dialogue: So, when they ride horses and fly on the birds, they also use their ponytails.

00:00:16:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:16:060000.Dialogue: My point is, if I were a horse or a bird, I'd be very nervous around James Cameron.

00:00:22:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:22:000000.Dialogue: It amazes me how you constantly obsess over fictional details when there are more important things in the real world to worry about. For example, why wasn't William Shatner in the new Star Trek movie?

00:00:33:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:33:140000.Dialogue: Hey, Sheldon. I was up in the administration office, and I happened to overhear the name of the winner of this year's Chancellor's Award for Science.

00:00:41:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:41:040000.Dialogue: And you want to rub my nose in the fact that my contributions are being overlooked again? I am the William Shatner of theoretical physics.

00:00:49:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:49:030000.Dialogue: All right, I'll play. What self-important, preening fraud are they honoring this year?

00:00:53:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:53:090000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm so glad you asked it like that. You.

00:00:59:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:59:230000.Dialogue: I won! This is astonishing. Not that I won the award-- no one deserves it more. Actually, I guess I misspoke. It's not astonishing; more like inevitable.

00:01:11:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:11:180000.Dialogue: I'm not sure what to do first. Maybe I should call my mother. Wait! I know-- I'm going to conduct an interview with myself and post it online.

00:01:22:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:22:220000.Dialogue: Yeah, the one thing the William Shatner of theoretical physics needed was an ego boost.

00:02:13:070000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:02:13:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:13:070000.Dialogue: Didn't it look like that spear was going to go right through your skull?

00:02:17:030000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:02:17:030000.Speaker: Raj

00:02:20:030000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:02:20:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:20:030000.Dialogue: Hey, you didn't want a Slurpee at 7-Eleven, you don't get glasses.

00:02:26:130000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:02:26:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:26:130000.Dialogue: Oh, that will be another congratulatory call for me. Uh, mute, please.

00:02:31:050000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:02:31:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:31:050000.Dialogue: Wait, wait. Hang on-- flaming arrow.

00:02:36:170000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:02:36:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:36:170000.Dialogue: Hello? (TV audio muted) Oh, Chancellor Morton, how are you, sir?

00:02:42:220000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:02:42:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:42:220000.Dialogue: Yes, I was expecting your call. (quietly): Three years ago.

00:02:47:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:02:47:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:47:090000.Dialogue: SHELDON: I see. Wait. What happens if I choose not to give a speech? Uh-huh. And if I don't want to forfeit the award?

00:02:57:050000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:02:57:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:57:050000.Dialogue: Well, you've got that tied up in a neat little bow.

00:03:00:040000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:00:040000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:03:04:050000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:04:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:05:160000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:05:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:05:160000.Dialogue: They expect me to give a speech at the banquet. I can't give a speech.

00:03:09:230000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:09:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:09:230000.Dialogue: Well, no, you're mistaken. You give speeches all the time.

00:03:16:190000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:16:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:16:190000.Dialogue: What you can't do is shut up.

00:03:20:020000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:20:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:20:020000.Dialogue: KOOTHRAPPALI: Yeah, before the movie, you did 20 minutes on why guacamole turns brown.

00:03:26:050000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:26:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:26:050000.Dialogue: It turned brown while you were talking.

00:03:28:230000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:28:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:28:230000.Dialogue: I am perfectly comfortable speaking to small groups. I cannot speak to large crowds.

00:03:34:010000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:34:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:34:010000.Dialogue: What, to you, is a large crowd?

00:03:35:130000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:35:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:35:130000.Dialogue: Any group big enough to trample me to death.

00:03:39:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:39:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:39:090000.Dialogue: General rule of thumb is 36 adults or 70 children.

00:03:43:110000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:43:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:43:110000.Dialogue: Sheldon, congratulations. Brought you a cheesecake from work. You know, 'cause of your award, not because a busboy sneezed on it.

00:03:54:140000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:54:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:03:57:080000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:03:57:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:57:080000.Dialogue: Turns out the great Sheldon Cooper has stage fright.

00:04:01:010000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:04:01:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:01:010000.Dialogue: That's no reason to back out. You know, I once got a pretty big honor in high school, and I was terrified about appearing in front of a big crowd, but I went through with it, and you know what? The world looked pretty darn good sitting on a haystack in the back of a Ford F-150 as a member of the Corn Queen's court.

00:04:19:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:04:19:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:19:090000.Dialogue: Thank you. Yeah, I'll bear that in mind if I'm ever nominated for the Hillbilly Peace Prize.

00:04:26:130000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:04:26:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:29:000000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:04:29:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:29:000000.Dialogue: Am I? Let me tell you a story.

00:04:31:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:04:31:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:31:090000.Dialogue: Where's 70 children when you need them?

00:04:35:060000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:04:35:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:35:060000.Dialogue: I was 14 and graduating summa cum laude from college. "Summa cum laude" is Latin for "with highest honors."

00:04:43:060000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:04:43:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:43:060000.Dialogue: I just love how you always skip over the part where no one asks.

00:04:47:220000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:04:47:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:47:220000.Dialogue: I was valedictorian and expected to give an address. Even now, I can remember that moment when I walked up to the podium and looked out at the crowd. There must have been thousands of people. My heart started pounding in my chest. I began to hyperventilate. My vision became blurry, and before I knew it... Oh, dear.

00:05:07:080000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:05:07:080000.Speaker: Penny

00:05:08:230000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:05:08:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:08:230000.Dialogue: LEONARD: Sheldon? Sheldon, are you okay?

00:05:11:140000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching Avatar in 3D. All are wearing 3D glasses except Raj.
00:05:11:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:05:15:210000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:05:15:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:15:210000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Come on, Mother. You know why I can't accept the award. With all due respect, I don't think praying will help.

00:05:24:060000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:05:24:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:24:060000.Dialogue: No, I have not heard the song, "Jesus, Take the Wheel."

00:05:28:090000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:05:28:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:28:090000.Dialogue: No, no, no, no, no, no, no. You don't need to start singing it. Yes, I'll buy it on the iTunes, Mother. Good-bye, Mother. Hello.

00:05:45:000000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:05:45:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:45:000000.Dialogue: Sit down. We want to talk to you.

00:05:47:080000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:05:47:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:47:080000.Dialogue: Am I in trouble? Did my mother call you?

00:05:50:140000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:05:50:140000.Speaker: Penny

00:05:51:230000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:05:51:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:51:230000.Dialogue: LEONARD: We think we can help you with your stage fright.

00:05:55:160000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:05:55:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:55:160000.Dialogue: Oh, I doubt that. I haven't figured out a way, and I'm much smarter than all of you.

00:06:02:100000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:02:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:02:100000.Dialogue: Yes, but you're not smarter than all of us put together.

00:06:05:190000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:05:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:05:190000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry. That is what I meant.

00:06:09:190000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:09:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:09:190000.Dialogue: Okay. Your problem is, you're trying to do this all by yourself.

00:06:13:070000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:13:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:13:070000.Dialogue: We can help you. We can be your team. Like, uh, Professor Xavier and his X-Men.

00:06:21:170000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:21:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:06:24:130000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:24:130000.Speaker: Penny

00:06:26:180000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:26:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:26:180000.Dialogue: Yeah, we watched it last week. You said you liked it.

00:06:29:090000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:29:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:29:090000.Dialogue: Oh. I say a lot of things, sweetie. So, how about it, Sheldon?

00:06:35:000000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:35:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:35:000000.Dialogue: I don't know. If you're my X-Men, what are your powers?

00:06:39:230000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:39:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:39:230000.Dialogue: Okay. Well, I am going to take you shopping, get you a nice suit. Might give you more confidence.

00:06:45:050000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:45:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:45:050000.Dialogue: That's not exactly a mutation that would get you into Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters, but go on. Leonard?

00:06:51:160000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:51:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:51:160000.Dialogue: I thought I could try to analyze you and get to the root of your anxiety.

00:06:55:180000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:55:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:55:180000.Dialogue: What qualifies you to attempt to understand my mind?

00:06:59:030000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:06:59:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:59:030000.Dialogue: My mother is a highly regarded psychiatrist, and I've been in therapy ever since she accused me of breast-feeding codependently.

00:07:09:130000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:07:09:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:09:130000.Dialogue: Raj says he can teach you... What did you call it? I don't know-- some Indian meditation crap.

00:07:18:150000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:07:18:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:18:150000.Dialogue: I see. Well, I assume, since the rest of you have set the bar so low, you're saving the most impressive contribution for last. Go ahead, Howard. Dazzle me.

00:07:30:120000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:07:30:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:30:120000.Dialogue: My power is the ability to pretend like I give a damn about your piddily-ass problems.

00:07:42:140000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:07:42:140000.Speaker: Howard

00:07:46:150000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:07:46:150000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:07:50:160000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:07:50:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:50:160000.Dialogue: So, what do you say, Sheldon? Are we your X-Men?

00:07:53:160000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:07:53:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:53:160000.Dialogue: No. The X-Men were named for the "X" in Charles Xavier. Since I am Sheldon Cooper, you will be my C-Men.

00:08:07:150000.Scene: The stairwell. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:08:07:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:07:150000.Dialogue: Oh, that's not a good name.

00:08:14:140000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:08:14:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:14:140000.Dialogue: Okay, Sheldon. I'm going to be leading you through a series of meditation exercises. These methods come from the ancient gurus of India and have helped me overcome my own fears.

00:08:27:110000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:08:27:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:27:110000.Dialogue: And yet, you can't speak to women.

00:08:31:150000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:08:31:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:31:150000.Dialogue: True, but thanks to meditation, I am able to stay in the same room with them without urinating.

00:08:38:150000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:08:38:150000.Speaker: Raj

00:08:42:020000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:08:42:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:45:010000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:08:45:010000.Speaker: Raj

00:08:46:100000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:08:46:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:46:100000.Dialogue: When I was little, my sister would say to me, "Close your eyes, you'll get a surprise," and then she'd punch me.

00:08:52:090000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:08:52:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:52:090000.Dialogue: I'm not going to punch you.

00:08:54:050000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:08:54:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:54:050000.Dialogue: That's what my sister used to say.

00:08:57:020000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:08:57:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:57:020000.Dialogue: Do you want to do this or not?

00:08:58:160000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:08:58:160000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:00:110000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:00:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:00:110000.Dialogue: All right. (clears throat) Imagine yourself in the one place you feel most at home. Where is that?

00:09:07:090000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:07:090000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:11:170000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:11:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:11:170000.Dialogue: More specifically, the Sim City I designed-- Sheldonopolis.

00:09:17:030000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:17:030000.Speaker: Raj

00:09:19:140000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:19:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:19:140000.Dialogue: Where exactly? Sheldon Square? Sheldon Towers? Sheldon Stadium, home of the Fighting Sheldons?

00:09:27:030000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:27:030000.Speaker: Raj

00:09:28:150000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:28:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:28:150000.Dialogue: I thought this was supposed to be a guided meditation.

00:09:31:100000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:31:100000.Speaker: Raj

00:09:34:060000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:34:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:34:060000.Dialogue: Really? This time of year? It's a bit nippy.

00:09:36:200000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:36:200000.Speaker: Raj

00:09:38:220000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:38:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:38:220000.Dialogue: Suppose I could run downtown and pick up something at Shel-Mart.

00:09:44:040000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:44:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:44:040000.Dialogue: Yeah, whatever. Just go buy a sweater.

00:09:46:030000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:46:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:46:030000.Dialogue: You know, the nice thing about Shel-Mart is I own it, so I get a 15% discount.

00:09:50:210000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:50:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:50:210000.Dialogue: You own the damn thing. Just take a freaking sweater!

00:09:54:140000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:54:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:54:140000.Dialogue: Look, I didn't turn a profit last quarter by taking product off the shelves willy-nilly.

00:09:59:180000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:09:59:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:59:180000.Dialogue: All right. You've paid for a sweater, and you're in Sheldon Square.

00:10:06:140000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:10:06:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:06:140000.Dialogue: (clears throat) Hang on. It's a cardigan. I have to button it.

00:10:15:180000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:10:15:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:17:040000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:10:17:040000.Speaker: Raj

00:10:18:080000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:10:18:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:18:080000.Dialogue: A Godzilla-like monster is approaching the city.

00:10:21:090000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:10:21:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:21:090000.Dialogue: I have to get my people to safety. People of Sheldonopolis, this is your mayor. Follow me. If the children can't run, leave them behind.

00:10:33:090000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:10:33:090000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:45:130000.Scene: The apartment. Raj is lighting candles. Indian music is playing.
00:10:45:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:45:130000.Dialogue: Raj? Just as I suspected. Meditation is nothing but hokum.

00:11:00:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:00:200000.Dialogue: I question your premise. How is a new suit going to prevent me from passing out in front of a ballroom full of people?

00:11:07:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:07:020000.Dialogue: It'll give you confidence. You know, sometimes when I'm feeling all stressed out about something, I go out and buy a cute top or a fun skirt and I have a whole new outlook on life.

00:11:16:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:16:060000.Dialogue: Don't you eventually realize you're just the same stressed out person in a cute top or a fun skirt?

00:11:22:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:22:040000.Dialogue: Yeah, that's when I buy shoes.

00:11:25:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:25:220000.Dialogue: Now, let's see what we've got. Ooh! This is nice.

00:11:35:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:35:090000.Dialogue: That's a lot of money for only one color.

00:11:38:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:38:140000.Dialogue: Fine. Why don't you pick out what you like.

00:11:56:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:56:130000.Dialogue: This is great. I had a suit like this when I was six.

00:12:05:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:05:160000.Dialogue: Okay, I think we have a winner.

00:12:10:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:10:130000.Dialogue: Where the hell'd you find that?

00:12:16:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:16:040000.Dialogue: Says the former member of the Corn Queen's Court.

00:12:21:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:21:000000.Dialogue: Please just try this one on.

00:12:23:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:23:150000.Dialogue: Okay. But anything I put on now is only going to suffer in comparison.

00:12:34:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:34:160000.Dialogue: This is absurd. I look like a clown.

00:12:48:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:48:050000.Dialogue: That's how you start a psychotherapy session? "How am I doing?" I was promised a riverboat journey into the jungles of my subconscious. Instead, I get the same question I hear from the lady who slices my bologna at Ralph's.

00:13:06:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:06:020000.Dialogue: Would it be helpful to you if I told you about my dreams?

00:13:12:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:12:050000.Dialogue: I recently had a dream that I was a giant. But everything around me was to scale, so it all looked normal.

00:13:24:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:24:210000.Dialogue: How did you know you were a giant if everything was to scale?

00:13:29:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:29:010000.Dialogue: I was wearing size a million pants.

00:13:37:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:37:180000.Dialogue: Ah. The talking cure. Classical Freudian. Good choice. If it will help speed things along, uh, my answers to the standard Rorschach ink blot test are: A) a bat, B) a bat, C) a bat, and D) my father killing my mother with a hypodermic needle.

00:13:58:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:58:060000.Dialogue: Why don't I just start? Sheldon (now in a sparkly green suit with rhinestones) people have trouble accepting accolades if, on a subconscious level, they don't feel they deserve them. Do you think maybe that's what's happening here?

00:14:15:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:15:030000.Dialogue: You're just going to try to recycle Adler's doctrine of the inferiority complex? I could probably get that from the woman at Ralph's. And she'd let me taste some pieces of cheese for free.

00:14:25:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:25:190000.Dialogue: But it could be part of your problem. Let me give you an example. When I was eight, I won a ribbon at the science fair for my project, "Do Lima Beans Grow Better to Classical Music." But my mother pointed out that it was just a rehash of my brother's earlier "Do Lima Beans Grow Worse to Rock 'n' Roll."

00:14:46:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:46:070000.Dialogue: I felt so guilty, I gave the ribbon back.

00:14:50:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:50:000000.Dialogue: And how did that make you feel?

00:14:52:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:52:140000.Dialogue: Terrible. I worked really hard on that project. I stayed up all night singing the clown's aria from Pagliacci to a lima bean sprout.

00:15:07:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:07:060000.Dialogue: It wasn't my fault. I had never seen my brother's project. And my mother could've told me before instead of at the ceremony in front of everyone.

00:15:18:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:18:050000.Dialogue: So, I hear you saying you're angry with your mother.

00:15:22:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:22:160000.Dialogue: Damn right, I'm angry with my mother.

00:15:30:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:30:210000.Dialogue: For God's sake, I was eight years old. She humiliated me. That's when the bed-wetting started again.

00:15:44:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:44:000000.Dialogue: If someone as damaged as you can find his way to crawl out of bed each morning, I think I can face a simple award ceremony.

00:15:51:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:51:140000.Dialogue: Wait, that's it? I thought we had a whole hour!

00:15:57:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:57:080000.Dialogue: Good evening, ladies and gentlemen. My name is Dr. Leonard Hofstadter, and it is my very great honor to introduce the winner of this year's Chancellor's award for Science and my good friend, Dr. Sheldon Cooper. But before I do, I'd like to share with you a letter from Sheldon's mother, who couldn't be here tonight. Isn't that nice? His mother sent him a letter. She's proud of him. I wonder what that feels like.

00:16:26:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:26:000000.Dialogue: Anyway, "Dear Shelly." That's what she calls him. Shelly-- it's a pet name. You know what my mother's pet name for me is? Leonard.

00:16:47:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:47:180000.Dialogue: Don't worry. You're surrounded by your C-Men.

00:16:53:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:53:100000.Dialogue: I can't do this. I'm going to faint.

00:16:55:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:55:190000.Dialogue: Here, drink this. It'll relax you.

00:17:05:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:05:160000.Dialogue: I don't feel different. This alcohol is defective.

00:17:09:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:09:030000.Dialogue: Here, see if this one works.

00:17:13:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:13:060000.Dialogue: First of all, the projects were totally different.

00:17:19:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:19:130000.Dialogue: I was showing that classical music nurtures lima beans and makes them grow, but my mother didn't hear me. If you'd like to look at the relationship between nurturing and growth, I'd like to point out that my brother is eight inches taller than me.

00:17:35:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:35:080000.Dialogue: Oh, right. Ladies and gentlemen, our guest of honor Dr. Sheldon Cooper.

00:17:45:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:45:130000.Dialogue: Thanks, shorty, I'll take it from here. All right, you people ready to have some fun? You have a basic understanding of differential calculus and at least one year of algebraic topology? Well, then here come the jokes.

00:18:00:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:00:130000.Dialogue: Why did the chicken cross the Mobius strip? To get to the same side-- bazinga!

00:18:07:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:07:230000.Dialogue: All right, a neutron walks into a bar and asks, "How much for a drink?" The bartender says, "For you, no charge."

00:18:18:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:18:110000.Dialogue: Hello? I know you're out there. I can hear you metabolizing oxygen and expelling carbon dioxide.

00:18:28:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:28:040000.Dialogue: Looks like we have some academic dignitaries in the audience. Dr. Randall from the geology department-- only man who's happy when they take his work for granite. Ba-da cha!

00:18:40:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:40:020000.Dialogue: I kid the geologists, of course, but it's only 'cause I have no respect for the field.

00:18:45:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:45:150000.Dialogue: Let's get serious for a moment.

00:18:52:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:52:030000.Dialogue: Why are we all here? 'Cause we're scientists. And what do scientists study? The universe. And what's the universe made of? I am so glad you asked.

00:19:43:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:43:090000.Dialogue: Penny, Leonard. Would you be able to answer some questions I'm having about the events of last night?

00:19:53:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:53:020000.Dialogue: Question one... where are my pants?

00:19:57:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:57:050000.Dialogue: You might want to check YouTube.

00:20:03:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:03:020000.Dialogue: It's already loaded. Just hit play.

00:20:07:200000.Speaker: On-screen Sheldon
00:20:07:200000.Dialogue: SHELDON (on video): All right, people, let's get down to the math. It is only three dimensional thinking that limits our imagination. Can I take my pants off over my head? Of course not. My body's in the way. But if we had access to higher dimensions, we could move our pants around our bodies through the fourth dimension

00:20:35:200000.Speaker: On-screen Sheldon
00:20:35:200000.Dialogue: and our days of dropping trousers would be over.

00:20:43:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:43:050000.Dialogue: Oh, Lord... This couldn't be any more humiliating.

00:20:48:170000.Speaker: On-screen Sheldon
00:20:48:170000.Dialogue: Now, for the astronomers in the audience, get ready to see the dark side of the moon.
